messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

opt: /tmp/llvm-gh-134115/build/llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRangeList.h:36: llvm::ConstantRangeList::ConstantRangeList(llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::ConstantRange>): Assertion `isOrderedRanges(RangesRef)' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/opt -p function-attrs /testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll -disable-output
1.	Running pass "cgscc(function-attrs)" on module "/testcases/llvm-gh-134115/input/poc.ll"

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

 1| //===- ConstantRangeList.h - A list of constant ranges ----------*- C++ -*-===//
 2| //
 3| // Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.
 4| // See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.
 5| // SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception
 6| //
 7| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
 8| //
 9| // Represent a list of signed ConstantRange and do NOT support wrap around the
10| // end of the numeric range. Ranges in the list are ordered and not overlapping.
11| // Ranges should have the same bitwidth. Each range's lower should be less than
12| // its upper.
13| //
14| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
15| 
16| #ifndef LLVM_IR_CONSTANTRANGELIST_H
17| #define LLVM_IR_CONSTANTRANGELIST_H
18| 
19| #include "llvm/ADT/APInt.h"
20| #include "llvm/IR/ConstantRange.h"
21| #include "llvm/Support/Debug.h"
22| #include <cstddef>
23| #include <cstdint>
24| 
25| namespace llvm {
26| 
27| class raw_ostream;
28| 
29| /// This class represents a list of constant ranges.
30| class [[nodiscard]] ConstantRangeList {
31|   SmallVector<ConstantRange, 2> Ranges;
32|

message.result:
Sorry, the patch is incorrect. Here is the applied patch, which may have been revised and differ from the original:
diff --git a/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp b/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp
index bbfed2ac2c09..7bada255727e 100644
--- a/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp
+++ b/llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp
@@ -696,8 +696,11 @@ ArgumentAccessInfo getArgumentAccessInfo(const Instruction *I,
       // doesn't have a fixed type size, we conservatively set as a clobber
       // with an empty access range.
       if (auto TypeAccessRange =
-              GetTypeAccessRange(LI->getAccessType(), ArgUse.Offset))
-        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, {*TypeAccessRange}};
+              GetTypeAccessRange(LI->getAccessType(), ArgUse.Offset)) {
+        ConstantRangeList AccessRanges;
+        AccessRanges.insert(*TypeAccessRange);
+        return {ArgumentAccessInfo::AccessType::Read, std::move(AccessRanges)};
+      }
     }
   } else if (auto *MemSet = dyn_cast<MemSetInst>(I)) {
     if (!MemSet->isVolatile()) {

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 1 to line 30 in llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRange.h:
 1| //===- ConstantRange.h - Represent a range ----------------------*- C++ -*-===//
 2| //
 3| // Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.
 4| // See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.
 5| // SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception
 6| //
 7| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
 8| //
 9| // Represent a range of possible values that may occur when the program is run
10| // for an integral value.  This keeps track of a lower and upper bound for the
11| // constant, which MAY wrap around the end of the numeric range.  To do this, it
12| // keeps track of a [lower, upper) bound, which specifies an interval just like
13| // STL iterators.  When used with boolean values, the following are important
14| // ranges: :
15| //
16| //  [F, F) = {}     = Empty set
17| //  [T, F) = {T}
18| //  [F, T) = {F}
19| //  [T, T) = {F, T} = Full set
20| //
21| // The other integral ranges use min/max values for special range values. For
22| // example, for 8-bit types, it uses:
23| // [0, 0)     = {}       = Empty set
24| // [255, 255) = {0..255} = Full Set
25| //
26| // Note that ConstantRange can be used to represent either signed or
27| // unsigned ranges.
28| //
29| //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
30|

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 91 to line 130 in llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRange.h:
 91|   /// indicates whether the constant range should not wrap in the signed or
 92|   /// unsigned domain.
 93|   static ConstantRange fromKnownBits(const KnownBits &Known, bool IsSigned);
 94| 
 95|   /// Split the ConstantRange into positive and negative components, ignoring
 96|   /// zero values.
 97|   std::pair<ConstantRange, ConstantRange> splitPosNeg() const;
 98| 
 99|   /// Produce the smallest range such that all values that may satisfy the given
100|   /// predicate with any value contained within Other is contained in the
101|   /// returned range.  Formally, this returns a superset of
102|   /// 'union over all y in Other . { x : icmp op x y is true }'.  If the exact
103|   /// answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value will be a
104|   /// proper superset of the above.
105|   ///
106|   /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 [2, 5) returns Result = [0, 4)
107|   static ConstantRange makeAllowedICmpRegion(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
108|                                              const ConstantRange &Other);
109| 
110|   /// Produce the largest range such that all values in the returned range
111|   /// satisfy the given predicate with all values contained within Other.
112|   /// Formally, this returns a subset of
113|   /// 'intersection over all y in Other . { x : icmp op x y is true }'.  If the
114|   /// exact answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value
115|   /// will be a proper subset of the above.
116|   ///
117|   /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 [2, 5) returns [0, 2)
118|   static ConstantRange makeSatisfyingICmpRegion(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
119|                                                 const ConstantRange &Other);
120| 
121|   /// Produce the exact range such that all values in the returned range satisfy
122|   /// the given predicate with any value contained within Other. Formally, this
123|   /// returns the exact answer when the superset of 'union over all y in Other
124|   /// is exactly same as the subset of intersection over all y in Other.
125|   /// { x : icmp op x y is true}'.
126|   ///
127|   /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 3 returns [0, 3)
128|   static ConstantRange makeExactICmpRegion(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
129|                                            const APInt &Other);
130|

Here is the code snippet from line 131 to line 170 in llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantRange.h:
131|   /// Does the predicate \p Pred hold between ranges this and \p Other?
132|   /// NOTE: false does not mean that inverse predicate holds!
133|   bool icmp(CmpInst::Predicate Pred, const ConstantRange &Other) const;
134| 
135|   /// Return true iff CR1 ult CR2 is equivalent to CR1 slt CR2.
136|   /// Does not depend on strictness/direction of the predicate.
137|   static bool
138|   areInsensitiveToSignednessOfICmpPredicate(const ConstantRange &CR1,
139|                                             const ConstantRange &CR2);
140| 
141|   /// Return true iff CR1 ult CR2 is equivalent to CR1 sge CR2.
142|   /// Does not depend on strictness/direction of the predicate.
143|   static bool
144|   areInsensitiveToSignednessOfInvertedICmpPredicate(const ConstantRange &CR1,
145|                                                     const ConstantRange &CR2);
146| 
147|   /// If the comparison between constant ranges this and Other
148|   /// is insensitive to the signedness of the comparison predicate,
149|   /// return a predicate equivalent to \p Pred, with flipped signedness
150|   /// (i.e. unsigned instead of signed or vice versa), and maybe inverted,
151|   /// otherwise returns CmpInst::Predicate::BAD_ICMP_PREDICATE.
152|   static CmpInst::Predicate
153|   getEquivalentPredWithFlippedSignedness(CmpInst::Predicate Pred,
154|                                          const ConstantRange &CR1,
155|                                          const ConstantRange &CR2);
156| 
157|   /// Produce the largest range containing all X such that "X BinOp Y" is
158|   /// guaranteed not to wrap (overflow) for *all* Y in Other. However, there may
159|   /// be *some* Y in Other for which additional X not contained in the result
160|   /// also do not overflow.
161|   ///
162|   /// NoWrapKind must be one of OBO::NoUnsignedWrap or OBO::NoSignedWrap.
163|   ///
164|   /// Examples:
165|   ///  typedef OverflowingBinaryOperator OBO;
166|   ///  #define MGNR makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion
167|   ///  MGNR(Add, [i8 1, 2), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == [-128, 127)
168|   ///  MGNR(Add, [i8 1, 2), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == [0, -1)
169|   ///  MGNR(Add, [i8 0, 1), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == Full Set
170|   ///  MGNR(Add, [i8 -1, 6), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == [INT_MIN+1, INT_MAX-4)

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/lib/Transforms/IPO/FunctionAttrs.cpp', 'start_line': 655, 'end_line': 725}`
responded: The patch still fails to build, which suggests that the structure of the function or the return type may not allow returning in this way, or there may be a logic/flow issue. However, the logic for handling the invalid range is correct.

**Next step:**  
Let's check the function signature and the context around the return statements to ensure that returning from within the `if` block is valid and that the function's return type matches. Let's view a larger context of the function to see if there are any issues with the return statements or control flow.

message.result: patch found
